page.title: 09London Airport - Heathrow
page.content:
The major airport for England is sited on the historic site, Hounslow Heath, of highwayman fame. There are still in existence the row of very old cottages known as Heathrow that gave the name to the airport. They are totally engulfed by the airport but still lived in.
The airport is the major source of employment in the area.
A new terminal is due to open this year, 1985, bringing the number to four. There is also a debate as to whether a fifth will be built.
The main objection to this is that it may increase traffic movements, air and surface, thus aggravating noise and air pollution.
